page.title: 18HAWARDEN CASTLE
page.content: Llywelyn Prince of Wales. In 1264 Simon De Monfort had taken the King of England prisoner, and he therefore had control of the country. Simon now agreed to give Hawarden to Llywelyn, however De Monfort was defeated by the King and Llwelyn had to reach an agreement with the King over his new lands.In 1277 King Edward the First decided to invade Walesand the Monalts who controlled the Hawarden area gave 1000 archers and spearmen. The castle was started in approximately 1278 and was a massive stone building.
